title: Bridging Information Gaps with Comprehensive Answers: Improving the Diversity and Informativeness of Follow-Up Questions
author: Zhe Liu (University of British Columbia), Taekyu Kang (University of British Columbia), Haoyu Wang, Seyed Hossein Alavi, Vered Shwartz (University of British Columbia), ...
relevance_why: The methods proposed in this paper, focusing on enhancing follow-up question generation, could be beneficial for improving dialog systems and audio-based applications by ensuring better context understanding and information retrieval.
background: The paper addresses the challenge of generating effective follow-up questions in conversational systems by identifying information gaps in initial answers.
contribution: This paper introduces a data augmentation pipeline that generates follow-up questions based on the contrast between original and comprehensive answers, achieving significant improvements in quality and diversity.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods primarily focused on generating answerable questions from context, often resulting in repetitive or contextually bound queries.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work enhances follow-up question generation by explicitly modeling information gaps and synthesizing comprehensive answers to drive question diversity.

key_innovation: The approach uniquely utilizes LLM-generated comprehensive answers to identify and target unanswered information gaps, simulating human cognitive strategies.
real_world_impact: This method has potential applications in various domains such as education and healthcare, leading to improved user interactions with AI systems and fostering more productive dialogues.
limitations: The approach may not effectively apply to opinion-based questions where information gaps are subjective.

new_terms.comprehensive answer: **Comprehensive answer** refers to a complete response to a question that includes various perspectives and details, as generated by a language model.
new_terms.follow-up question generation: **Follow-up question generation** is the task of creating additional questions that further explore or clarify the information provided in a previous question-answer pair.
